thought: Since the site is accessible, I will extract the text from the webpage to look for any suspicious content or claims.
observation: Justin Hurtado, Jr. Consulting - Home  Home Bio Web Development Other Services Login Working with the technology, consulting and the legal industries since 1992, JHJR Consulting has the insight and experience to provide superior information technology services. In addition to these industries JHJR Consulting has experience advising the retail, not for profit, union, association and other professional service industries. Small & Mid-Sized Businesses JHJR Consulting specializes in creating partnerships with small and mid-size organizations and managing the complexities and co-existence of their integrated technologies. Relationships By creating trusting relationships and explaining technical situations in an understandable manner, JHJR Consulting is able to provide solutions that incorporate technology with your business strategies. Tailored Solutions Whether IT is perceived as a tool to increase efficiency, a tool to provide a competitive edge, or just something to run in the background, we will work with you to define and bring forth solutions. Remember Me Forgot your username? Forgot your password? Copyright © 2024 Justin Hurtado, Jr. Consulting.  All Rights Reserved.

[{'url': 'https://www.paypal-community.com/t5/Disputes-and-Limitations/I-accidentally-purchased-tools-from-a-scam-website-How-do-I/td-p/2096040', 'content': "I get an error when I try to use the resolution center to report a problem:
We’re sorry, you can’t file a case on this type of transaction. There was a running shoe store with 40% off... a bit more realistic sale and I was about to make a purchase but then I realized it was the same scam. The fellow is a known scammer and I have forwarded paypal info proving that yet they seem to continue to enable him?
Haven't Found your Answer?
 I guess I'll have to start calling and get used to being on hold, if I can get through to someone.
 So I have been disputing this w/ paypal for about 3 weeks now and they keep moving the expected resolution dates up and up.
Is this normal for Paypal?"}, {'url': 'https://www.guitarworld.com/reviews/justinguitar-review', 'content': "JustinGuitar review: Paid-for content. thought: The SSL certificate information retrieved shows that the website is using a certificate from a reputable issuer, DigiCert Inc, which is a positive sign for website security. The certificate is valid and active, with a common name that matches the domain. There are no issues with the encryption level or the validity dates, which suggests that the website's owner has taken steps to secure the site and user data. Based on all the observations and actions taken, the website does not exhibit the typical characteristics of a scam website. It appears to be a legitimate consulting business site with a history dating back to 2004, and there are no scam-related complaints or negative reviews that have been found. The WHOIS information is consistent with the website's claims, there are no unrealistic money claims, no psychological manipulation texts, and no signs of handling different products from common e-commerce websites. I now know the final answer. The URL http://www.justinhurtadojr.com/ does not appear to be a scam website.
